thread.title: Liverpool transfer news and rumours: Reds starlet Brooks Lennon set for MLS loan switch?
thread.title_full: Liverpool transfer news and rumours: Reds starlet Brooks Lennon set for MLS loan switch?

author: James Whaling
title: Liverpool transfer news and rumours: Reds starlet Brooks Lennon set for MLS loan switch?
text:
Lennon is set to return to the MLS on loan (Photo: Getty) Share Get Liverpool FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Liverpool youngster Brooks Lennon is set to sign for MLS outfit Real Salt Lake on loan for the 2017 season. 
The 19-year-old joined the Reds from the US side in July 2015 and will now return to his homeland on a temporary switch, report the Liverpool Echo. 
Lennon is under contract at Anfield until the summer of 2018 and has progressed from the Under-18 to the Under-23 squad in Merseyside. 
But he is yet to force his way into the first-team reckoning and Jurgen Klopp is hopeful the move can provide some invaluable experience. Coutinho ready to spearhead title charge Coutinho could start at Old Trafford (Photo: PA) 
Philippe Coutinho is ready to boost Liverpool’s title challenge at Old Trafford and admits: I feared I’d be out for the whole season, writes Mirror Football's Chris Hatherall. 
“It would be special to play at Old Trafford but it is down to the coach and he always makes the best choice for the success of the team,” he said. 
“Just to be back is a dream. The blow to my ankle was really hard and initially I thought I would be out for the rest of the season. 
“There were lot of nerves because I honestly thought my season was finished. But luckily I have recovered without problems." Klopp ready to park the bus Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
